raw_response: {"answer_index": 0, "answer_text": "Schizotypal personality disorder", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "The patient exhibits paranoid personality disorder features: pervasive distrust and suspiciousness (doesn't trust neighbors, doubts wife's fidelity, suspicious of marriage counselor), interpreting others' motives as malevolent (boss was 'jealous'), and being critical/complaining. Paranoid personality disorder belongs to Cluster A (odd/eccentric) of personality disorders. Schizotypal personality disorder also belongs to Cluster A, along with schizoid personality disorder. Obsessive-compulsive personality disorder is Cluster C (anxious/fearful), antisocial personality disorder is Cluster B (dramatic/erratic), and 'personality disorder NOS' is not a cluster designation. Therefore, schizotypal personality disorder is the correct answer as it shares the same cluster classification."}
